article_title: The Okinawa Threat to U.S.-Japan Defense Ties
article_text:
Tokyo

U.S.-Japanese security ties are a major theme of this week’s U.S. tour by Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, during which he and President Barack Obama have announced updated defense-alliance guidelines for the first time in two decades. Amid strong bilateral cooperation concerning joint military training, missile defense and other issues, however, the matter of U.S. military bases on the Japanese island of Okinawa remains...

twitter.description: The onus is on U.S. military personnel to build stronger ties with locals, says Yukie Yoshikawa in The Wall Street Journal.
twitter.title: The Okinawa Threat to U.S.-Japan Defense Ties
